tit.e: Tango no kuni Fudoki (the records of Tango Province)
Tango no kuni Fudoki (the records of Tango Province)
Tango no kuni Fudoki (the records of Tango Province)

sen.j: 『丹後国風土記』（たんごのくにふどき）は、丹後国（今の京都府北部）の風土記。
sen.e: "Tango no kuni Fudoki (the records of Tango Province) is a record of Tango Province (now the northen part of Kyoto Prefecture).
"Tango no kuni Fudoki (The records of Tango Province)" is a record of Tango Province (now the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture).
"Tango no kuni Fudoki" (The records of Tango Province) is a record of Tango Province (now the northern part of Kyoto Prefecture).

sen.j: 逸文であるため、内容は 『釋日本紀』 などでの引用によるしかない。
sen.e: Since it's a lost book, the contents are only found as quotations in the "Shoyu Nihongi"(a commentary of the Nihonshoki) and some other books.
Because it's a lost book, the contents are only found as quotations in the "Shoyu Nihongi"(a commentary of the Nihonshoki) and some other books.
Because it's a lost book, the contents are only found as quotations in the "Shoyu Nihongi" (a commentary of the Nihonshoki) and some other books.
sen.cmt: " と(の間にスペースを挿入しました。

sen.j: 風土記編纂が命じられたのが和銅６年（713年）であるため、原本は遅くとも8世紀中にはできていたと思われる。
sen.e: Because Fudoki (the description of regional climate, culture, etc.) was compiled by Imperial order around in 713, it seems the original text was existed in the middle of 8th century, at the latest.

Because Fudoki (the description of regional climate, culture, etc.) was compiled by imperial order in around 713, it seems that the original text came into existence during the middle of eighth century at the latest.

Because Fudoki (the description of regional climate, culture, etc.) was compiled by imperial order in around 713, it seems that the original text came into existence during the middle of eighth century at the latest.

sen.j: 数多くある風土記逸文の中でも比較的長文が残されている。
sen.e: Among a number of lost books of the Fudoki, Tango no Kuni Fudoki relatively remains long articles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Among a number of lost books of the Fudoki, Tango no Kuni Fudoki remains as relatively long articles.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Among a number of lost books of the Fudoki, Tango no Kuni Fudoki remains as relatively long articles.

sen.j: 最古の部類に入る浦島伝説、羽衣伝説の記述は万葉仮名書きの和歌が入っている点も含めて特筆すべきものである。
sen.e: Urashima Legend and Hagoromo (a heavenly feathers robe) Legend that belong to the oldest articles are especially unique, including Japanese poems written in Manyo-gana (ancient Japanese writing system using Chinese chracters).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The legends of Urashima and Hagoromo (a robe of heavenly feathers), which belong to the oldest articles, are particularly unique, including Japanese poems written in Manyo-gana (an ancient Japanese writing system using Chinese characters).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The legends of Urashima and Hagoromo (a robe of heavenly feathers), which belong to the oldest articles, are particularly unique, including Japanese poems written in Manyo-gana (an ancient Japanese writing system using Chinese characters).

sen.j: 他に、天橋立の伝承もある。
sen.e: There is also Amano Hashidate (Bridge to Heaven) Legend.
There is also the legend of Amano Hashidate (Bridge to Heaven).
There is also the legend of Amano Hashidate (Bridge to Heaven).

sen.j: （下に挙げる和歌は漢字仮名交じり文で記す）
sen.e: (The following Japanese poems are written in kanji and kana)
(The following Japanese poems are written in kanji and kana:)
(The following Japanese poems are written in kanji and kana:)

sen.j: 「筒川嶼子 水江浦島子」という項目に記述がある。
sen.e: The arcicle, 'Tsutsukawa no Shimako, Mizunoe Urashima no ko' provides description.
sen.cmt: 「筒川」「水江」は姓ではないので、名前や地名と同じように語頭だけを大文字にしました。以下に続く単語は読み方が出典により、やや違うため、こちらのサイト（ブログ）を元にしました。http://pub.ne.jp/urashimasetuwa/
sen.e: The arcicle, 'Tsutsukawa no Shimako, Mizunoe Urashima no ko,' provides a description.
The article, 'Tsutsukawa no Shimako, Mizunoe Urashima no ko,' provides a description.

sen.j: 「天上仙家」や「蓬山」が出てくるなど中国渡来の神仙思想が伺える。
sen.e: With the words of 'Heavenly immortal place' or 'Immortal land', the idea of immortal, Shenxian, from China is seen.
With the words 'heavenly immortal place' or 'immortal land,' the idea of immortals, Shenxian, from China, is seen.
With the words 'heavenly immortal place' or 'immortal land,' the idea of immortals, Shenxian, from China, is seen.

sen.j: 「水江浦島子」が童話に出てくる浦島太郎である。
sen.e: Mizunoe Urashima no ko'was regarded as Urashima Taro, a man from Japanese popular children's story.
Mizunoe Urashima no ko'was regarded as Urashima Taro, a man from a popular Japanese children's story.
Mizunoe Urashima no ko' was regarded as Urashima Taro, a man from a popular Japanese children's story.
sen.cmt: ko' とwasの間にスペースを挿入しました。

sen.j: 筒川の里、日下部首等の先祖に姿容秀美の筒川嶼子という者、即ち水江浦島子がいた。
sen.e: A good looking man, Tsutsukawa no Sihmako, or Mizunoe Urashima no ko, who was an ancestor of KUSAKABE no Obito and others, lived in Tsutsukawa no sato region.
sen.cmt: このパラグラフから「浦島」の話しが始まっているので、本来ならクォーテーションでくくるのだと思います。
sen.e: A good-looking man, Tsutsukawa no Shimako, or Mizunoe Urashima no ko, who was an ancestor of KUSAKABE no Obito and others, lived in the region of Tsutsukawa no sato.
A good-looking man, Tsutsukawa no Shimako, or Mizunoe Urashima no ko, who was an ancestor of KUSAKABE no Obito and others, lived in the region of Tsutsukawa no sato.

sen.j: 伊預部馬養連の記したところのものを述べる。
sen.e: IYOBE no Umakai no Muraji described as follows.
IYOBE no Umakai no Muraji described as follows:
IYOBE no Umakai no Muraji described as follows:

sen.j: と前置きされている。
sen.e: The story was introduced as above.
sen.cmt: 原文は「と前置きした上で」です。但し原文通りに訳すと、以下の文章と全く主語が合わなくなるため、意味が通るように「と、話が前置きされている」と直しました。
sen.e: The story was introduced as above.
The story was introduced as above.

sen.j: 長谷朝倉宮御宇天皇（雄略天皇）の御世、浦島子は小舟に乗り釣りに出た。
sen.e: During the reign of Emperor Hatsuse no Asakura no Miya (Emperor Yuryaku), Urashima no ko went fishing on a small boat.
During the reign of Emperor Hatsuse no Asakura no Miya (Emperor Yuryaku), Urashima no ko went fishing in a small boat.
During the reign of the Emperor Hatsuse no Asakura no Miya (the Emperor Yuryaku), Urashima no ko went fishing in a small boat.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 三日三晩の間一匹の魚も釣れなかったが五色の亀だけ得る。
sen.e: For three days and three nights, he didn't catch any fish, but a five-colored turtle.
For three days and three nights, he didn't catch any fish, but he did catch a five-colored turtle.
For three days and three nights, he didn't catch any fish, but he did catch a five-colored turtle.

sen.j: 奇異に思ったが眠っている間に亀は比べることもなき美麗な婦人と為った。
sen.e: He felt it strange, but while he was sleeping, the turtle turned into the most beautiful woman he had ever seen,
He felt it was strange, but while he was sleeping the turtle turned into the most beautiful woman he had ever seen,
He felt it was strange, but while he was sleeping the turtle turned into the most beautiful woman he had ever seen,

sen.j: 女娘は問答の中「天上仙家之人也」と己を語る。
sen.e: During their conversation, she talked about herself, saying, 'I am from a heavenly immortal place.'
During their conversation, she talked about herself, saying, 'I am from a heavenly, immortal place.'
During their conversation, she talked about herself, saying, 'I am from a heavenly, immortal place.'

sen.j: 彼女が眠るように命じ浦島子が目覚めると、不意の間に海中の大きな島に至っていた。
sen.e: She told Urashima no ko to sleep, and when he woke up, before he knew, they had arrived at a big island under the sea.
She told Urashima no ko to sleep, and when he woke up, before he knew, they had arrived at a big island under the sea.
She told Urashima no ko to sleep, and when he woke up, before he knew, they had arrived at a big island under the sea.

sen.j: 館の門に入ると七人の童子、八人の童子が迎えた。
sen.e: When they entered the gate of the palace, seven children and eight children saw him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When they entered the gate of the palace, seven children and eight children saw him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When they entered the gate of the palace, seven children and eight children saw him.

sen.j: 彼らはそれぞれ「すばるぼし」（プレアデス星団）と「あめふりぼし」（ヒアデス星団）だという。
sen.e: They introduced themselves as 'Subaru-boshi stars' (the Pleiades) and 'Amefuri-boshi stars' (the Hyades) respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They introduced themselves as 'Subaru-boshi stars (the Pleiades)' and 'Amefuri-boshi stars (the Hyades),' respectively.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They introduced themselves as 'Subaru-boshi stars' (the Pleiades) and 'Amefuri-boshi stars' (the Hyades), respectively.

sen.j: 女娘は父母と共に迎え、歓待の合間に人界と仙都の別を説く。
sen.e: The woman welcomed him with her parents and during the entertainment, she told him the difference between a human world and an immortal land.
The woman welcomed him along with her parents, and during the entertainment she told him the difference between the human world and an immortal land.
The woman welcomed him along with her parents, and during the entertainment she told him the difference between the human world and an immortal land.

sen.j: 館に留まること三年経ち、浦島子は郷里の事を思い出し、神仙之堺に居るよりも俗世に還ることを希望する。
sen.e: After staying in the palace for three years, Urashima no ko missed his home-town and hoped to return to the mundane world instead of being in the Heavenly Immortal world.
He stayed in the palace for three years, but eventually Urashima no ko missed his hometown and hoped to return to the mundane world instead of being in the heavenly, immortal world.
He stayed in the palace for three years, but eventually Urashima no ko missed his hometown and hoped to return to the mundane world instead of being in the heavenly, immortal world.

sen.j: 女娘は別れを悲しみながらも、玉匣（たまくしげ）を渡し「戻ってくる気ならゆめゆめ開けるなかれ」と忠告する。
sen.e: Tearfully saying good-bye to him, his wife gave him a tamakushige (a casket) and warned him, 'Never ever open the casket if you want to come back again.'
Tearfully saying goodbye to him, his wife gave him a tamakushige (a casket) and warned him, 'Never, ever open the casket if you want to come back again.'
Tearfully saying goodbye to him, his wife gave him a tamakushige (a casket) and warned him, 'Never, ever open the casket if you want to come back again.'

sen.j: 帰り着いて辺りが変わっているので郷の者に聞いた。
sen.e: Returning to find the neighborhood changed, he asked a man in the village.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Returning to find the neighborhood changed, he asked a man in the village.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Returning to find the neighborhood changed, he asked a man in the village.

sen.j: 浦島子は蒼海に出たまま帰らなかったということにされていた。
sen.e: It had been said Urashima no ko went to the sea but never came back.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It had been said that Urashima no ko went to sea but never came back.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It had been said that Urashima no ko went to sea but never came back.

sen.j: 玉匣を開くと風雲に翩飛けるような変化が起きた。
sen.e: When he opened the Tamakushige, the change happened as if something fluttered and flew into the winds and clouds.
sen.cmt: この文の意味の解釈が複数あるようなので、意訳になってしまいますが主語としてsomething を補いました。http://pub.ne.jp/urashimasetuwa/?monthly_id=200905&page=2 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: When he opened the Tamakushige, the change happened as if something had fluttered and flown into the winds and clouds.
When he opened the Tamakushige, the change happened as if something had fluttered and flown into the winds and clouds.

sen.j: 浦島子は涙に咽（むせ）び徘徊し、歌を詠む……
sen.e: Urashima no ko was choked with tears, walking around, singing :
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Urashima no ko, choked with tears, walked around, singing:
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Urashima no ko, choked with tears, walked around, singing:

sen.j: 常世邊に 雲立ち渡る 水江の 浦嶋の子が 言持ち渡る
sen.e: Clouds drift away to the land of the dead with Mizunoeno Urashima's message.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Clouds drift away to the land of the dead with Mizunoeno Urashima's message.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Clouds drift away to the land of the dead with Mizunoeno Urashima's message.

sen.j: 神女遙飛,芳音で歌いて曰く：
sen.e: The godess sings, with her beautiful voice echoing.
The goddess sings, and her beautiful voice echos.
The goddess sings, and her beautiful voice echos.

sen.j: 倭邊に 風吹き上げて 雲離れ 退き居り共よ 我を忘らすな
sen.e: Don't forget me, even wind blows away the clouds in Yamato, your place.
Don't forget me; even the wind blows away the clouds in Yamato, your place.
Don't forget me; even the wind blows away the clouds in Yamato, your place.

sen.j: 浦嶼子：
sen.e: Urashimano-ko:
Urashimano-ko:
Urashimano-ko:

sen.j: 子等に戀ひ 朝戸を開き 我が居れば 常世の濱の 波の音聞こゆ
sen.e: In the morning, when I open the door, missing you, I hear the sound of the waves from the land of the dead.
In the morning, when I open the door, missing you, I hear the sound of the waves from the land of the dead.
In the morning, when I open the door, missing you, I hear the sound of the waves from the land of the dead.

sen.j: 後世の人歌いて曰く：
sen.e: People of succeeding gengerations sang:
People of succeeding gengerations would sing:
People of succeeding generations would sing:

sen.j: 水江の 浦嶋の子が 玉匣 開けず有りせば 復も會はましを
sen.e: If Mizunoeno Urashima had not opened the casket, he could have met her again.
If Mizunoeno Urashima had not opened the casket, he could have met her again.
If Mizunoeno Urashima had not opened the casket, he could have met her again.

sen.j: 常世邊に 雲立ち渡る 多由女 雲は繼がめど 我そ悲しき
sen.e: Clouds are drifting into the land of the dead but I can't see her, how sad.
Clouds are drifting into the land of the dead but I can't see her, how sad.
Clouds are drifting into the land of the dead but I can't see her, how sad.

sen.j: 別の書『古事談』では、「淳和天皇御宇天長二年（825年）乙巳。
sen.e: In another book, "Kojidan"(Talks of the Past) said, 'In 825, the reign of Emperor Junwa,
In another book, "Kojidan (Talks of the Past)," it is stated, 'In 825, the reign of Emperor Junwa,

sen.cmt: ()を" "の外に出しました。Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

sen.j: 丹後国与佐郡人水江浦島子。
sen.e: Mizunoe Urashima no ko in Yosa County, Tango Province,
Mizunoe Urashima no ko in Yosa County, Tango Province,
Mizunoe Urashima no ko in Yosa County, Tango Province,

sen.j: 此年乗松船。
sen.e: he took a boat this year.
he took a boat this year,
he took a boat this year,

sen.j: 到故郷」と記され、そのことから帰還まで300年程度経ったと推定される。
sen.e: for his home village,' it said, then it seemed that 300 years passed, from his departure until his homecoming.
for his home village,' it said, then it seemed that 300 years had passed from the time of his departure until his homecoming.
for his home village,' it said, then it seemed that 300 years had passed from the time of his departure until his homecoming.

sen.j: 出発時の雄略天皇の代がいつなのか確定しがたいが、他の浦島伝説での共通点も踏まえ現世では館での3年より遙かに長い時間が流れていたと伝えられることは確実なようである。
sen.e: The time he departed, in the reign of Emperor Yuryaku, is not determined but considering other Urashima Legends, which have something in common suggest that time of this world must had passed far faster than that of three years in the palace.

The date of his departure, in the reign of Emperor Yuryaku, is not determined, but considering other Urashima legends, which have something in common, suggest that time of this world must had passed much faster than that of three years in the palace.

The date of his departure, in the reign of the Emperor Yuryaku, is not determined, but considering other Urashima legends, which have something in common, suggest that time of this world must had passed much faster than that of three years in the palace.
sen.cmt: Emperorの前にtheを挿入しました。

tit.e: The Hagoromo (Robe of Heavenly Feathers) Legend
The Hagoromo (Robe of Heavenly Feathers) Legend

sen.j: 「比治真奈井 奈具社」という項目に記述がある。
sen.e: The article, 'Hiji no Manai, Nagu no yashiro' describs as follows.
The article entitled 'Hiji no Manai, Nagu no yashiro' describes as follows:
The article entitled 'Hiji no Manai, Nagu no yashiro' describes as follows:

sen.j: 各地に伝わる羽衣伝説とは違い、物語の筋が一風変わったものになっている。
sen.e: Unlike other Hagoromo Legend handed down in other places, the story is unique.
Unlike other legends of Hagoromo handed down in other places, the story is unique.
Unlike other legends of Hagoromo handed down in other places, the story is unique.

sen.j: この里の比治山頂の麻奈井の湖（今は既に沼となったと書かれる）で、天女八人が水浴びしていたとき、和奈佐という老夫婦は一つの羽衣を隠し、帰れなかった天女を子にした。
sen.e: In Manai Lake (latterly it became a swamp, they say) in the village, eight tennyo (heavenly maidens) were bathing, but an elderly couple named Wasana hid a feathers robe and they adopted one tennyo, who lost her robe.

In Manai Lake (eventually it became a swamp, they say) in the village, eight tennyo (heavenly maidens) were bathing, but an elderly couple by the name of Wasana hid a robe of feathers and adopted one tennyo, who had lost her robe.

In Manai Lake (eventually it became a swamp, they say) in the village, eight tennyo (heavenly maidens) were bathing, but an elderly couple by the name of Wanasa hid a robe of feathers and adopted one tennyo, who had lost her robe.

sen.j: そのおかげで家は富む。
sen.e: Because of her, their home became rich.
Because of her, their home became rich.
Because of her, their home became rich.

sen.j: しかし豊かになると「汝は吾が子ではない」と言い天女を追い出してしまう。
sen.e: However, when they became rich, they drove her out, saying, 'You are not my child.'
However, when they became rich they drove her out, saying, 'You are not our child.'
However, when they became rich they drove her out, saying, 'You are not our child.'

sen.j: 天女は慟哭しつつそこを去る……
sen.e: The tennyo left with crying.
The tennyo left, crying.
The tennyo left, crying.

sen.j: 追い出した老夫婦の村はその後荒れる。
sen.e: After that, the villeage of the elderly couple, who drove her out, ruined.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that, the village of the elderly couple, who had driven her out, became a ruin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that, the village of the elderly couple, who had driven her out, became a ruin.

sen.j: 天女は現在の竹野郡弥栄町の奈具神社に豊宇気毘売神として祀られることになったという。
sen.e: The tennyo was, they say, enshrined in Nagu-jinja shrine, Yasaka Town, Takeno County, as Toyoukehime no kami (a goddess of food)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The tennyo was, they say, enshrined in Nagu-jinja shrine, Yasaka Town, Takeno County, as Toyoukehime no kami (a goddess of food).

sen.e: The tennyo was, they say, enshrined in Nagu-jinja shrine, Yasaka Town, Takeno County, as Toyoukehime no kami (a goddess of food).
